page.title: 19LOCAL DIALECT,CRW.AREA,TENBY
page.content: { Carew,like much of S.Pembrokeshire {has its own dialect.}Words deriving from the "forced" settlements of Flemings and the Norse settlements rather than Welsh. {Evil}_Garden fork.{Pile}_To throw. {Piat,Pyatt}_Magpie.{Gunning}_staring. {Balls}_Culm Balls of clay and anthra_ cite dust used as fuel. {Stum}_To stum the fire at night,bank up the fire with Culm balls. {Abroad}_To take something apart;in pieces.{Slop}_A gap in a hedge. {Caffle}_String,wool or harness in a tangle.{Tamot}_A small cart load. {Skirping}_Just starting to rain. {Tallet}_A small loft where one slept. {Grip}_Gutter or ditch at the roadside. {Gunkal}_Deep ditch or water course. {Emmett,Emmeck}_Ant. {Lonker}_To tie animal's legs to restrict wandering.
